algorithm_technique: Use dynamic programming to store the length of consecutive 1s in four directions (up, down, left, right) for each cell.
problem_summary_simple: Find the order of the largest axis-aligned plus sign of 1s in a grid with some mines (0s).
problem_summary_technical: DP approach calculating consecutive 1s in four directions for each cell, then taking the minimum and maximum plus sign order.
key_insights: The order of a plus sign at (r, c) is limited by the shortest arm extending from it.
We can precompute the lengths of consecutive 1s in all four directions (left, right, up, down) for each cell.
The final answer for a cell is the minimum of these four lengths, and we seek the maximum among all cells.
